issues.description: The template’s addGuestStudents method signature includes an extra boolean parameter (validateInput) that neither the problem statement nor the UML diagram specifies. Students are instructed to implement addGuestStudents(int) but the template stub forces them to implement addGuestStudents(int, boolean), causing confusion and mismatch with the solution reference.
issues.suggested_fix: Update the template stub to match the specified signature: remove the boolean parameter so the method reads public void addGuestStudents(int numberOfNewGuestStudents) { ... }.

issues.description: The template defines the addGuestStudents method with two parameters (int numberOfNewGuestStudents, boolean validateInput), but the problem statement and solution specify a single-parameter method addGuestStudents(int). This signature mismatch will confuse students and cause test failures since the provided stub does not match the required method signature.
issues.suggested_fix: Update the template stub to match the specification and solution: change the method signature to public void addGuestStudents(int numberOfNewGuestStudents) and remove the boolean validateInput parameter.
